intro: Parasenecio hastiformis, commonly known as the hastifolius ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
